archimate:ApplicationComponent.name: HIS System
archimate:ApplicationComponent.documentation:
The Hospital Information System serves as the central nervous system of healthcare facilities, integrating all administrative, financial, and clinical operations. HIS manages patient registration, admission, discharge, and transfer processes while coordinating bed management and resource allocation. It handles billing, insurance claims, and financial reporting, providing real-time visibility into hospital operations. The system typically includes modules for scheduling, inventory management, and human resources, creating a unified platform that connects all departments. Modern HIS platforms feature web-based interfaces, mobile accessibility, and sophisticated reporting capabilities that enable administrators to make data-driven decisions about resource utilization, patient flow, and operational efficiency.
Core Functionalities:
• Patient administration (admission, discharge, transfer – ADT) • Billing and revenue cycle management • Scheduling and appointment systems • Departmental management (wards, ICU, ER) • Clinical data integration with EHR, RIS, PACS, LIMS
Workflows: • Patient check-in → Diagnostic requests → Clinical documentation → Billing → Discharge summary
Data Types: • Demographics, ADT events, financial records, service utilization logs
Integration Points: • EHR: For clinical records • ERP: For financial and supply chain • RIS/PACS/LIMS: For diagnostics • HRIS: For staff scheduling
Example Software: • RioMed Cellma • Meditech • Cerner Millennium • InterSystems TrakCare
